formalpara.title: Figure 16. The C. briggsae micro mutant.
formalpara.para: From Nigon and Dougherty (1950), with permission from Oxford University Press. (A) Wild-type C. briggsae hermaphrodite adult. (B) micro mutant. (C) Cross of the micro mutant with wild-type males and segregation by selfing of hermaphrodites in the F2 and F3 generations. Genotypes are in grey. The micro mutation segregates as a single locus. (D) Backcross of the F1 males to mutant hermaphrodites, showing absence of linkage to the sex chromosome.
